publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: The foregoing Verses were communicated to Mr. Shenstone by Mr. Dodsley, as the Composition of Dean Swift ... [erasure of three lines] ... they are not consistent with the Dean's known principles. P.

The foregoing Verses are printed but very defectively in a publication of Mr. Griffith's (author of The Letters from Henry to Frances) intitled The Friends or Original Letters of a Person deceased. Lond. 1773 2 vol. 12. See page 77 of Vol. 2nd, they are ascribd. to Dean Swift, in that Work. [Footnotes by Percy.]

578-$5X1 1 ONCE, with a whirl of Thought opprest,578-$5X1 2 I sunk from Reverie, to rest──578-$5X1 3 An horrid vision seizd my Head:578-$5X1 4 I saw the Graves give up their dead;578-$5X1 5 Jove arm'd with terror burst the skies;578-$5X1 6 The thunder roars, the Lightning flies.578-$5X1 7 Confused, Amazed, it's Fate unknown578-$5X1 8 The world stands trembling at his throne578-$5X1 9 While each pale sinner hangs his head578-$5X1 10 Jove nodding shook the Heavn's & said578-$5X1 11 `Offending race of human kind578-$5X1 12 `By nature, custom, learning blind578-$5X1 13 `You who, thro Frailty slip'd aside578-$5X1 14 `And you never fell, thro Pride;578-$5X1 15 `And you, by differing churches shamm'd578-$5X1 16 `Who come to see each other damn'd!578-$5X1 17 ──So some Folks told you──but they knew578-$5X1 18 No more of Joves designs than you.578-$5X1 19 The worlds mad business now is oer578-$5X1 20 And I resent those Pranks no more578-$5X1 21 I to such Blockheads set my Wit!578-$5X1 22 I damn such Fools! Go, go youre bit.578-$5X1
